X.ii.5.C.1.a
.
Handling a CUE That, When Corrected, Will Not Benefit the Beneficiary
Follow the instructions in the table below following identification of a clear and unmistakable error (CUE) in a rating decision that, when corrected, will
not
benefit the beneficiary.
Important
:
Always follow the instructions in the table below when correction of a CUE involves the severance of service connection (SC), even if severing SC will not affect the current or a prior combined disability evaluation.
Exceptions
:  Disregard the instructions in the table below and follow the instructions in
M21-1, Part X, Subpart ii, 5.B
, if SC is severed because the granting of SC was clearly illegal, or
M21-1, Part X, Subpart ii, 5.C.1.b
, if correction of an erroneously assigned effective date or disability evaluation does not result in a reduction in the current or a prior combined disability evaluation.
Example
:  Follow the instructions in the table below if
the rating activity erroneously assigned an effective date of May 23, 2015, for a grant of SC for a disability the rating activity evaluated as 30-percent disabling
the Veteran has
no
other service-connected (SC) disabilities, and
the proper effective date is October 19, 2015.
Step
Action
1
Establish end product (EP) 930.
Exception
:  Do not establish EP 930 if a rating EP, such as EP 020, is already pending.
2
Prepare a rating decision that
proposes correction of the error, and
cites all the material facts and justification for the proposed action.
Important
:  If correction of the error could result in the assignment of a reduced evaluation for an SC disability, include in the rating decision the proposed
evaluation of the disability in question, and
combined evaluation, if applicable.
Reference
:  For more information on rating decisions that propose a reduction in a disability evaluation, see
M21-1, Part X, Subpart ii, 3.D
.
3
Obtain approval of the proposed rating action from one of the officials identified in
M21-1, Part X, Subpart ii, 5.A.3.e
.
Important
:  Do
not
inform the beneficiary or beneficiary’s power of attorney of the proposed rating action before obtaining the approval referenced in this step.
4
Was an EP 930 established in Step 1?
If
yes
,
clear the EP 930, and
establish EP 600.
If
no
,
promulgate the rating decision under the pending rating EP, and
establish EP 600.
Note
:  Promulgation of a rating decision prepared under EP 930 might be necessary under the following rare circumstance:
the EP 930 was established based on the discovery of
multiple
CUEs, and
correction of one or more of the CUEs would not constitute an adverse action.
5
Does the CUE consist
only
of the assignment of an incorrect effective date?
If
yes
, go to Step 16.
If
no
, go to the next step.
6
Prepare a notice of proposed adverse action that meets the requirements set forth in
M21-1, Part X, Subpart ii, 3.A.2
.
Important
:
Notify the beneficiary that the effective date of the proposed action will be the first day of the month following a 60-day period that begins the date of the notice of the final rating decision.
If the beneficiary is a Veteran, invite them to submit
VA Form 21P-527EZ, Application for Veterans Pension
, if
basic eligibility for pension exists, and
it appears pension might be the greater or only benefit to which the Veteran might be entitled.
Reference
:  For more information on establishing entitlement to pension, see
M21-1, Part IX, Subpart i, 2
.
7
Did the beneficiary respond to the notice of proposed adverse action within 65 days?
If
yes
, go to the next step.
If
no
, go to Step 13.
8
Did the beneficiary request a hearing within 30 days of the date of the notice of proposed adverse action?
If
yes
, go to the next step
after
the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA)
holds the hearing, and
obtains any relevant evidence the beneficiary identified during the hearing (or determines the evidence is unavailable).
If
no
, go to the next step.
9
Did the beneficiary provide evidence showing
no
CUE exists?
If
yes
, go to the next step.
If
no
, go to Step 13.
10
Prepare a rating decision that confirms and continues the prior rating decision.
Obtain approval of the rating decision from one of the officials identified in
M21-1, Part X, Subpart ii, 5.A.3.e
.
Exception
:  Approval by one of the officials identified in
M21-1, Part X, Subpart ii, 5.A.3.e
, is
not
required if
a Decision Review Officer decides no CUE exists, and
the decision involves an issue on a legacy appeal.
11
Promulgate the rating decision.
12
Notify the beneficiary that VA will
not
take the action it proposed.
Disregard the remaining steps in this table.
13
Prepare a rating decision that corrects the error.
Update the
Codesheet
so that it reads how it should have read had no error been made.
Important
:  If the beneficiary submitted any kind of evidence in response to the notice of proposed adverse action referenced in Step 6, obtain approval of the rating decision from one of the officials identified in
M21-1, Part X, Subpart ii, 5.A.3.e
,
before
going to the next step.
Exception
:  When the CUE involves severance of SC that results in the discontinuation of all compensation (no SC disabilities or only noncompensable SC disabilities remain), do not update the
Codesheet
so that it reads how it should have read had no error been made.  Instead, follow the interim procedures provided in the document titled
SOP for CUE Severance Award Processing
.
14
Will promulgation of the rating decision result in an overpayment of benefits that equals or exceeds $25,000?
If
yes
,
follow the instructions in
M21-1, Part VI, Subpart i, 2.B.3.g and h
, replacing the term “administrative decision” with “rating decision,” and
go to the next step following receipt of approval from Compensation Service or Pension and Fiduciary (P&F) Service.
If
no
, go to the next step.
15
Establish EP 960, using the date VA discovered the error as the date of claim
promulgate the EP 600 rating decision, adjusting the award to ensure
no overpayment is created, and
the beneficiary will continue to receive their current rate of payment until the first day of the month following a 60-day period that begins the date of the notice of the final rating decision, and
go to Step 23.
Example
:  If the date of the notice of the final rating decision is April 22, then
60 days following that date is June 21, and
the first day of the following month is July 1.
Reference
:  For more information on EP 960 usage in relation to the adverse action proposal period, see
M21-1, Part X, Subpart ii, 3.B.4.b
.
16
Prepare a notice of proposed adverse action that meets the requirements set forth in
M21-1, Part X, Subpart ii, 3.A.2
.
17
Did the beneficiary respond to the notice of proposed adverse action within 65 days?
If
yes
, go to the next step.
If
no
, go to Step 20.
18
Did the beneficiary request a hearing within 30 days of the date of the notice of proposed adverse action?
If
yes
, go to the next step
after
VA
holds the hearing, and
obtains any relevant evidence the beneficiary identified during the hearing (or determines the evidence is unavailable).
If
no
, go to the next step.
19
Did the beneficiary provide evidence showing
no
CUE exists?
If
yes
, return to Step 10.
If
no
, go to the next step.
20
Prepare a rating decision that corrects the error.
Update the
Codesheet
so that it reads how it should have read had no error been made.
Important
:  If the beneficiary submitted any kind of evidence in response to the notice of proposed adverse action referenced in Step 16, obtain approval of the rating decision from one of the officials identified in
M21-1, Part X, Subpart ii, 5.A.3.e
,
before
going to the next step.
Exception
:  When the CUE involves severance of SC that results in the discontinuation of all compensation (no SC disabilities or only noncompensable SC disabilities remain), do not update the
Codesheet
so that it reads how it should have read had no error been made.  Instead, follow the interim procedures provided in the document titled
SOP for CUE Severance Award Processing
.
21
Will promulgation of the rating decision result in an overpayment of benefits that equals or exceeds $25,000?
If
yes
,
follow the instructions in
M21-1, Part VI, Subpart i, 2.B.3.g and h
, replacing the term “administrative decision” with “rating decision,” and
go to the next step following receipt of approval from Compensation Service or P&F Service.
If
no
, go to the next step.
22
Establish EP 960, using the date VA discovered the error as the date of claim, and
promulgate the EP 600 rating decision, following the instructions
in the table
in
M21-1, Part VI, Subpart iii, 2.B.3.e
, to ensure no overpayment is created.
Reference
:  For more information on EP 960 usage in relation to the adverse action proposal period, see
M21-1, Part X, Subpart ii, 3.B.4.b
.
23
Notify the beneficiary of the action taken
clear the EP 960, and
add the
Clear and Unmistakable Error
flash to the corporate record.
24
Update the CUE Tracker according to the instructions in
M21-1, Part X, Subpart ii, 5.A.3.f
.
References
:  For more information on
handling CUEs, see
38 CFR 3.105(a)
, and
M21-1, Part X, Subpart ii, 5.A
notifying a beneficiary of actions VA has taken, see
M21-1, Part VI, Subpart i, 1.B
, and
addressing multiple issues in a single rating decision, when at least one of the issues involves the correction of a CUE, see
M21-1, Part X, Subpart ii, 5.C.1.d
.
title: M21-1, Part X, Subpart ii, Chapter 5, Section C - Due Process and Authorization Issues for Clear and Unmistakable Error (CUE)
